author: Al Ke
comment: Please add option to disable "Add new event" and "Options" icons on the widget. If I hide them, I can still click accidentally. P.S. If you put it on  your github, I can help

author: Chris Straessle
comment: Very nice calendar widget. However really wish there was an option to enable event text to be colored based on the calendar color; that's the one option I really miss from another widget which is no longer maintained.

author: Roni Oliven
comment: Great app, very customizable! The only thing missing in my opinion is the option to see and delete tasks (like the not very customizable onboard calendar app can) . Other than that, wonderful. Very useful

author: raining dogs
comment: Finally I found this simple widget which satisfies my exact need. 5 stars if date and event can be on same line.

author: A Google User
comment: Looked fantastic on my Motorola RAZR M and still looks great on my new Moto E4. If these guys did a similar widget for mail, my UI would be complete.

author: mas goendoel
comment: Great app bro. Very useful.  Can i request? Please add more language to this app..like bahasa indonesia.  Thanks in advance

author: F McG
comment: Doesn't update to current day unless I enter the app settings and exit out. Please fix. Else, great app.

author: Benjamin Green
comment: Seriously great app. One of my few must haves for each device I get.

author: Robert Paloutzian
comment: Almost perfect widget. Would really like to see an option to put date and event on the same line.

author: Nick T
comment: Whatever the last update did broke the ability to bold event times/dates

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: Please send me a mail if you need support

author: Remco Bruijne
comment: great widget wih super nice layout flexibility. One issue seems to be that if you have a multi day meeting in the next year, you only see the 1st day. And a multi day meeting starting this year, extending into next year, will only show up this year. Not a show stopper for sure but a fix would be appreciated (if that is a bug)

author: Andre Laurent
comment: Was really effective, but Android 7.1.1 update issues. The widget does not allow viewing of "yesterday", also today's past events, birthdays, all day events are not visible.   Poor showing for a calendar app.

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: The app does not show events from the past, correct (as I dont see why anyone would need that). It does however show birthdays and all day events on the whole day they occur. Please send me a mail if you need support

author: derx
comment: Great app. I'd love to see a feature where it displays the number of years of a birthday or anniversary after the event text. Ex. Birthday blah (19) for 19 years.

author: Helga
comment: Love this widget, but if I choose the "show today, tomorrow instead of dates", I get two tomorrow's... one for real tomorrow and one for the day after tomorrow.

author: Graham Street
comment: Used to be so good. But now the settings are completely jumbled. Good response from dev now ok.
Only issue I have is that I don't have access to my outlook calendar

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: That's an issue of the outlook app on your device not sharing its calendar

author: Andrey Andronov
comment: I like it, but the calendar's text size should be changeable as well!

author: Bruce Scherzinger
comment: This widget is just perfect on my LG V10. Love it! Keep up the great work!

author: David Beecher
comment: This is the best calendar widget of them all.  I have tried many.  This is the most customizeable and most efficient.
Great widget. Would like the option to show empty days.

author: Emad H.
comment: Best and simplest calendar widget ever so far

author: Paul Friedrich
comment: All i need

author: Alexander Morugin
comment: Great widget.

author: A Rahman
comment: good one

author: Son of 8-Bits
comment: Great widget, works perfectly. Been using it for a good year now without any problems. Here's a some suggestions for the dev: 1) Right now you can set how many days/weeks/months/years it looks ahead for calendar items. Add the option to limit how many items I want displayed. 2) There's an option to display calendar colours. I'd like to see calendar names instead.

author: Chris Kwek
comment: It's great but how come malware scanners found trojan horse?  It's scanned by Samsung's built in security software (Nougat for note 5). I have crossed check with another trojan software as 'second opinion' with same result.   This is in fact the best widget I ever have. But in view of recent ransomeware episodes, I just need to be more cautious.  Didnt mean to give bad ratings. Apologies.
Great agenda but no way to lock the time zone. If you are traveling times get shifted instead of showing you the event in the home time Zone. Bummer.

author: Marcin Michalik
comment: There is problem with tomorrow and day after tomorrow. I think just 'today' and 'tomorrow' is enough and there is no need for day after tomorrow. Right now we have 2 tomorrow's :( please fix

author: Mauri Galvez
comment: Clicking on an effect should bring up that event, not that day, even when there is more than 1 event on that day. When fixed, 5*!

author: Srinivasa Reddy
comment: Recently I switched from Gmail to Microsoft Outlook Android email app. Now calendar widget is not showing my company (office365) account calendar events. Earlier these were displayed with Gmail.

author: erick hidayat
comment: GREAT UI for some1 who used Symbian before but with extended usability. Créme de la créme...

author: Phx Music
comment: Thank you for so many customization options! I have been looking for such a widget for ages!
No internet permission required. Thanks.

author: xoua xiong
comment: Does what I need it to do.

author: Frederic Merle
comment: The best. Case closed

author: J Deines
comment: Best calender there is

author: tony Evans
comment: Cool app

author: SS VLS
comment: Good

author: Denis Projata
comment: Just  installed and it shows that i did but when i went to open it, it was just gone and no where to find. Bad app. Dont waist your time

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: You should have read the text in the popup the app showed before removing its icon. Its a widget. There is no reason for it to have an icon in the app launcher. Google on how to uses widgets before installing a widget

author: Peter Šepetavc
comment: Great widget, but latest update made it unusable: events are scrambled, info missing, formatting has glitches, etc.

reply.author: j4velin
reply.content: Please send me a mail if you need support
